batch_results.title: NIST AC-1
batch_results.mapping_notes: AC-1 is primarily about policy and procedures, which cannot be implemented programmatically through GCP SDK/API calls. Therefore, no existing GCP functions are applicable.

batch_results.title: NIST AC-2

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_iam_automated_account_management
new_functions_needed.rationale: Automated account management is needed to create, enable, modify, disable, and remove accounts programmatically.

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_iam_account_usage_monitoring
new_functions_needed.rationale: Monitoring account usage is essential for compliance with account management requirements.

batch_results.mapping_notes: While some aspects of account management can be addressed with existing IAM functions, additional automated mechanisms are needed for complete compliance.

batch_results.title: NIST AC-3

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_network_access_enforcement
new_functions_needed.rationale: To enforce access policies at the network level, ensuring only authorized access is permitted.

batch_results.mapping_notes: Existing network security functions provide good coverage for access enforcement, but additional functions for specific access policy enforcement at the application level may be required.

batch_results.title: NIST AC-4

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_network_information_flow_control
new_functions_needed.rationale: To enforce information flow control policies within and between systems.

batch_results.mapping_notes: GCP's existing network functions provide strong support for information flow enforcement, but additional specific controls for dynamic flow policies may be beneficial.

batch_results.title: NIST AC-5

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_iam_separation_of_duties_enforcement
new_functions_needed.rationale: To define and enforce separation of duties through role-based access controls.

batch_results.mapping_notes: Separation of duties requires defining roles and permissions, which can be partially addressed through IAM roles, but further programmatic enforcement is needed.

batch_results.title: NIST AC-11

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_compute_device_lock_inactivity_timeout
new_functions_needed.rationale: To programmatically enforce device lock after a period of inactivity, a function is needed to configure VM instances with an inactivity timeout that triggers a lock.

batch_results.mapping_notes: No existing GCP functions directly support device lock after inactivity. A new function is needed to set inactivity timeouts on compute instances.

batch_results.title: NIST AC-12

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_iam_session_termination_on_inactivity
new_functions_needed.rationale: To automatically terminate user sessions after a period of inactivity, a function is needed to manage session lifetimes and enforce termination.

batch_results.mapping_notes: No existing GCP functions directly support automatic session termination. A new function is needed to enforce session termination based on inactivity.

batch_results.title: NIST AC-14

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_iam_anonymous_access_audit
new_functions_needed.rationale: To identify actions that can be performed without authentication, a function is needed to audit IAM policies for anonymous access permissions.

batch_results.mapping_notes: Existing function partially covers the control by restricting public access to functions. Additional auditing of IAM policies is needed for comprehensive coverage.

batch_results.title: NIST AC-15
batch_results.mapping_notes: Control AC-15 is withdrawn and incorporated into MP-3, thus no functions are required.

batch_results.title: NIST AC-16

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_storage_attribute_association_management
new_functions_needed.rationale: To manage security and privacy attributes, a function is needed to associate and audit attributes on storage objects.

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_compute_dynamic_attribute_association
new_functions_needed.rationale: To dynamically associate attributes with compute resources, a function is needed to manage metadata attributes.

batch_results.mapping_notes: Existing functions cover auditing and encryption aspects. Additional functions are needed for dynamic attribute association and management on storage and compute resources.

batch_results.title: NIST AC-22

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_storage_public_access_monitoring
new_functions_needed.rationale: To monitor and alert on changes to public access settings for storage buckets.

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_compute_public_ip_monitoring
new_functions_needed.rationale: To detect and alert on instances with public IPs that may expose nonpublic information.

batch_results.mapping_notes: Existing functions help prevent public access, but additional monitoring functions are needed to ensure compliance with the control's review and monitoring requirements.

batch_results.title: NIST AC-23

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_bigquery_data_mining_detection
new_functions_needed.rationale: To detect patterns indicative of unauthorized data mining activities.

batch_results.mapping_notes: Audit logging provides some visibility, but specific detection mechanisms for data mining are needed to fully meet the control.

batch_results.title: NIST AC-24

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_iam_access_decision_logging
new_functions_needed.rationale: To log and review access control decisions for auditing and compliance.

batch_results.mapping_notes: Existing IAM functions help define access control, but logging of access decisions is needed for full compliance.

batch_results.title: NIST AC-25

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_compute_reference_monitor_implementation
new_functions_needed.rationale: To implement a reference monitor by configuring firewall rules that are tamper-proof and always invoked.

batch_results.mapping_notes: No existing functions directly implement a reference monitor. A new function to configure and enforce firewall rules is needed.

batch_results.title: NIST AT-1
batch_results.mapping_notes: This control is primarily procedural and policy-based, with no direct GCP functions applicable for programmatic implementation.

batch_results.title: NIST AU-1
batch_results.mapping_notes: AU-1 is primarily focused on policy and procedural documentation, which cannot be addressed through GCP SDK/API calls.

batch_results.title: NIST AU-1
batch_results.mapping_notes: AU-1 is primarily focused on policy and procedural documentation, which cannot be addressed through GCP SDK/API calls.

batch_results.title: NIST AU-3

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_logging_audit_record_content_verification
new_functions_needed.rationale: To ensure audit records contain all necessary information such as event type, timestamp, source, and outcome.

batch_results.mapping_notes: Existing functions provide a basis for audit logging, but a new function is needed to verify the completeness of audit record content.

batch_results.title: NIST AU-4

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_logging_storage_capacity_allocation
new_functions_needed.rationale: To allocate and manage audit log storage capacity according to organizational requirements.

batch_results.mapping_notes: While GCP provides logging capabilities, specific functions to manage storage capacity allocation are needed.

batch_results.title: NIST AU-5

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_logging_failure_alerts
new_functions_needed.rationale: To alert designated personnel in case of audit logging process failures.

batch_results.mapping_notes: Existing monitoring functions can be leveraged for alerting, but specific configurations for audit logging failures are needed.

batch_results.title: NIST CA-5

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_monitoring_plan_of_action_automation
new_functions_needed.rationale: Automated mechanisms are needed to ensure the accuracy, currency, and availability of the plan of action and milestones.

batch_results.mapping_notes: No existing GCP functions directly support the automation of plans of action and milestones. A new function is needed to automate the creation and management of these plans.

batch_results.title: NIST CA-6

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_iam_authorization_management
new_functions_needed.rationale: Programmatic management of authorizations is required to assign and update authorizing officials for systems and common controls.

batch_results.mapping_notes: GCP lacks direct support for managing authorizations of officials. A new IAM function is necessary to handle this requirement programmatically.

batch_results.title: NIST CA-7

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_monitoring_continuous_monitoring_strategy
new_functions_needed.rationale: A comprehensive strategy for continuous monitoring at the system level is needed to align with organizational strategies.

batch_results.mapping_notes: Existing logging and monitoring functions provide partial support for continuous monitoring. Additional functions are needed to fully implement a continuous monitoring strategy.

batch_results.title: NIST CA-8

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_security_penetration_testing
new_functions_needed.rationale: Automated support for scheduling and conducting penetration tests is needed, as current GCP functions do not cover this.

batch_results.mapping_notes: GCP does not provide built-in functions for penetration testing. A new security function is required to facilitate this process programmatically.

batch_results.title: NIST CA-9

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_network_internal_connection_authorization
new_functions_needed.rationale: Programmatic authorization and compliance checks for internal system connections are needed to ensure security and privacy compliance.

batch_results.mapping_notes: Existing network functions provide partial support for internal connections. Additional functions are needed for authorization and compliance checks.

batch_results.title: NIST CM-1
batch_results.mapping_notes: CM-1 is primarily about policy and procedures, which cannot be implemented programmatically using GCP SDK/API calls. No technical controls are applicable.

batch_results.title: NIST CM-2

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_compute_baseline_configuration_automation
new_functions_needed.rationale: To automate the maintenance of baseline configurations for compute instances.

batch_results.mapping_notes: CM-2 requires maintaining baseline configurations. Existing functions partially cover this by securing configurations, but automation for baseline maintenance is needed.

batch_results.title: NIST CM-3

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_logging_configuration_change_tracking
new_functions_needed.rationale: To track and document configuration changes automatically.

batch_results.mapping_notes: CM-3 involves change control, which is partially covered by logging and IAM policies. Additional automation for change tracking is suggested.

batch_results.title: NIST CM-4

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_security_impact_analysis_tool
new_functions_needed.rationale: To analyze potential impacts of changes on security and privacy.

batch_results.mapping_notes: CM-4 requires impact analysis prior to changes. No existing functions directly address this, so a new security impact analysis tool is proposed.

batch_results.title: NIST CM-5

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_iam_access_restriction_enforcement
new_functions_needed.rationale: To enforce and audit access restrictions programmatically.

batch_results.mapping_notes: CM-5 focuses on access restrictions for changes. IAM functions provide strong coverage, but additional enforcement mechanisms are suggested.

batch_results.title: NIST Item 1
batch_results.mapping_notes: No specific control description provided, unable to map existing GCP functions.

batch_results.mapping_notes: No specific control description provided, unable to map existing GCP functions.

batch_results.mapping_notes: No specific control description provided, unable to map existing GCP functions.

batch_results.title: NIST Item 5
batch_results.mapping_notes: No specific control description provided, unable to map existing GCP functions.

batch_results.title: NIST Item 1
batch_results.mapping_notes: No specific control description provided, unable to map to existing GCP functions.

batch_results.title: NIST Item 2
batch_results.mapping_notes: No specific control description provided, unable to map to existing GCP functions.

batch_results.title: NIST AC-6

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_iam_privileged_account_restriction
new_functions_needed.rationale: To restrict privileged accounts to organization-defined personnel or roles.

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_logging_privileged_function_execution
new_functions_needed.rationale: To log the execution of privileged functions.

batch_results.mapping_notes: The existing functions cover role restrictions and least privilege principles well, but additional functions are needed for logging privileged function execution and restricting privileged accounts.

batch_results.title: NIST AC-7

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_iam_invalid_logon_attempt_limit
new_functions_needed.rationale: To enforce a limit on consecutive invalid logon attempts and take predefined actions.

batch_results.mapping_notes: No existing GCP functions directly address invalid logon attempt limits. A new function is needed to implement this control.

batch_results.title: NIST AC-8

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_compute_display_login_banner
new_functions_needed.rationale: To display a system use notification message or banner before granting access.

batch_results.mapping_notes: GCP does not have a direct function for displaying login banners. A new function is needed to implement this control.

batch_results.title: NIST AC-9

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_iam_notify_last_logon
new_functions_needed.rationale: To notify users of the date and time of the last logon upon successful logon.

batch_results.mapping_notes: There is no existing GCP function to notify users of their last logon. A new function is required.

batch_results.title: NIST AC-10

new_functions_needed.name: gcp_iam_limit_concurrent_sessions
new_functions_needed.rationale: To limit the number of concurrent sessions for each account or account type.

batch_results.mapping_notes: GCP does not have a function to limit concurrent sessions. A new function is necessary to meet this requirement.
